AssociateTrackerConsumer.name: AssociateTrackerConsumer
AssociateTrackerConsumer.documentation: Creates an association between a geofence collection and a tracker resource. This allows the tracker resource to communicate location data to the associated geofence collection.

BatchDeleteGeofence.name: BatchDeleteGeofence
BatchDeleteGeofence.documentation:
Deletes a batch of geofences from a geofence collection.

This action deletes the resource permanently. You can't undo this action.

BatchEvaluateGeofences.name: BatchEvaluateGeofences
BatchEvaluateGeofences.documentation: Used in geofence monitoring. Evaluates device positions against the position of geofences in a given geofence collection.

BatchGetDevicePosition.name: BatchGetDevicePosition
BatchGetDevicePosition.documentation:
A batch request to retrieve device positions.

The response will return the device positions from the last 24 hours.

BatchPutGeofence.name: BatchPutGeofence
BatchPutGeofence.documentation: A batch request for adding geofences into a given geofence collection.

BatchUpdateDevicePosition.name: BatchUpdateDevicePosition
BatchUpdateDevicePosition.documentation:
Uploads a position update for one or more devices to a tracker resource. The data is used for API queries requesting the device position and position history.

Beta limitation — Location data will be sampled at a fixed rate of 1 position per minute, and retained for 24 hours before it expires.

CreateGeofenceCollection.name: CreateGeofenceCollection
CreateGeofenceCollection.documentation: Creates a geofence collection. A geofence collection manages and stores geofences.

CreateMap.name: CreateMap
CreateMap.documentation:
Creates a map resource in your AWS account.

A map resource lets you select a map style from an available provider.

CreatePlaceIndex.name: CreatePlaceIndex
CreatePlaceIndex.documentation:
Creates a place index resource in your AWS account.

Place indexes support geocoding and reverse geocoding queries using your chosen data source.

CreateTracker.name: CreateTracker
CreateTracker.documentation:
Creates a tracker resource in your AWS account.

A tracker resource receives a device position in the form of a DevicePostionUpdate.

DeleteGeofenceCollection.name: DeleteGeofenceCollection
DeleteGeofenceCollection.documentation:
Deletes a geofence collection from your AWS account.

This action deletes the resource permanently. You can't undo this action. If the geofence collection is the target of a tracker resource, the devices will no longer be monitored.

DeleteMap.name: DeleteMap
DeleteMap.documentation:
Deletes a map resource from your AWS account.

This action deletes the resource permanently. You cannot undo this action. If the map is being used in an application, the map may not render.

DeletePlaceIndex.name: DeletePlaceIndex
DeletePlaceIndex.documentation:
Deletes a place index resource from your AWS account.

You can't undo this action. This deletes the resource permanently.

DeleteTracker.name: DeleteTracker
DeleteTracker.documentation:
Deletes an existing tracker resource from your AWS account.

This action deletes the resource permanently. You can't undo this action. If the tracker resource is in use, you may encounter an error. Make sure that the target resource is not a dependency for your applications.

DescribePlaceIndex.name: DescribePlaceIndex
DescribePlaceIndex.documentation: Retrieves the resource details for a place index in your AWS account.

DescribeTracker.name: DescribeTracker
DescribeTracker.documentation: Retrieves the resource details for a tracker in your AWS account.

DisassociateTrackerConsumer.name: DisassociateTrackerConsumer
DisassociateTrackerConsumer.documentation: Removes the association bewteen a tracker resource and a geofence collection.

GetDevicePosition.name: GetDevicePosition
GetDevicePosition.documentation:
Retrieves the latest device position.

Beta limitation — Location data will be retained for 24 hours before it expires.

GetDevicePositionHistory.name: GetDevicePositionHistory
GetDevicePositionHistory.documentation:
Retrieves the device position history within a specified range of time.

Beta limitation — Location data will be retained for 24 hours before it expires.

GetGeofence.name: GetGeofence
GetGeofence.documentation: Retrieves the geofence details from a geofence collection.

GetMapGlyphs.name: GetMapGlyphs
GetMapGlyphs.documentation:
Retrieves the glyph file for a map resource.

The glyph file is used to detemine how text is displayed on the map.

GetMapSprites.name: GetMapSprites
GetMapSprites.documentation:
Retrieves the sprite file for a map resource.

The sprite file contains PNG images used to render icons on a map. The sprite file location is specified by a JSON document.

GetMapStyleDescriptor.name: GetMapStyleDescriptor
GetMapStyleDescriptor.documentation:
Retrieves the map style descriptor from a map resource.

The style descriptor contains specifications on how features will render on a map. For example, what data to display, what order to display the data in, and the style for the data.

GetMapTile.name: GetMapTile
GetMapTile.documentation:
Retrieves the map tile from the map resource.

Map tiles are used to display a map in a grid arrangement using an X axis, Y axis , and Z (zoom) parameter. The origin is referenced as (0/0) on the top left of the map.

ListGeofenceCollections.name: ListGeofenceCollections
ListGeofenceCollections.documentation: Lists geofence collections in your AWS account.

ListGeofences.name: ListGeofences
ListGeofences.documentation: Lists geofences stored in a given geofence collection.

ListMaps.name: ListMaps
ListMaps.documentation: Lists map resources in your AWS account.

ListPlaceIndexes.name: ListPlaceIndexes
ListPlaceIndexes.documentation: Returns a list of place index resources in your AWS account.

ListTrackerConsumers.name: ListTrackerConsumers
ListTrackerConsumers.documentation: Retrieves a list of geofence collections currently associated to the given tracker resource.

ListTrackers.name: ListTrackers
ListTrackers.documentation: Returns a list of tracker resources in your AWS account.

PutGeofence.name: PutGeofence
PutGeofence.documentation: Adds a new geofence to a given geofence collection, or updates the geometry of an existing geofence if a geofence ID is included in the request.

SearchPlaceIndexForPosition.name: SearchPlaceIndexForPosition
SearchPlaceIndexForPosition.documentation: Reverse geocodes a given coordinate and returns a legible address. Allows you to search for places or points of interest near a given position.

SearchPlaceIndexForText.name: SearchPlaceIndexForText
SearchPlaceIndexForText.documentation:
Geocodes free-form text, such as an address, name, city, or region to allow you to search for places or points of interest.

Includes the option to apply additional parameters to narrow your list of results.

You can search for results near a given position using BiasPosition, or results within a specific bounding box using FilterBBox. Providing both parameters simultaneously returns an error.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: The request was denied due to insufficient access or permission. Check with an administrator to verify your permissions.

ConsumerArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the geofence collection to be associated with the given tracker resource. An ARN is a unique identifier used to identify an AWS resource.

  • Format example: arn:partition:service:region:account-id:resource-type:resource-id

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource to be associated with a geofence collection.

Error.documentation: Specifies an error message associated with the request.

GeofenceId.documentation: The geofence associated with the error message.

BatchDeleteGeofenceError.documentation: Contains error details for each geofence that failed to delete from the geofence collection.

CollectionName.documentation: The geofence collection storing the geofences to be deleted.

GeofenceIds.documentation: The batch of geofences to be deleted.

Errors.documentation: Contains error details for each geofence that failed to delete.

DeviceId.documentation: The device identifier associated with the failed position evaluation.

Error.documentation: Specifies an error message associated with the request.

SampleTime.documentation:
Specifies a timestamp for when the error occurred.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

BatchEvaluateGeofencesError.documentation: Contains error details for each device that failed to evaluate its position against the geofences of a given geofence collection.

CollectionName.documentation: The name of the geofence collection to be used in evaluating the position of devices against its geofences.

DevicePositionUpdates.documentation: Contains device details for each device to be evaluated against the given geofence collection.

Errors.documentation: Contains error details for each device that failed to evaluate its position against the given geofence collection.

DeviceId.documentation: The ID of the device that didn't return a position.

Error.documentation: Provides additional details to add context to the error code.

BatchGetDevicePositionError.documentation: Contains error details for each device that didn't return a position.

DeviceIds.documentation:
The ID of the device whose position you want to retrieve.

  • For example, for two devices: device-ids=DeviceId1&device-ids=DeviceId2

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource retrieving the device position.

DevicePositions.documentation: The device position requested. Contains the position, and timestamps for each device specified in the request.

Errors.documentation: A summary that contains error details for each device that failed to send its position to the tracker resource.

Message.documentation: TODO: Karen, A message with the reason for the error.

BatchItemError.documentation: Contains details on an error that has occurred while processing a batch request.

Error.documentation: Specifies an error message associated with the request.

GeofenceId.documentation: The geofence associated with the error message.

BatchPutGeofenceError.documentation: Contains error details for each geofence that failed to add to a given geofence collection.

CollectionName.documentation: The name of the geofence collection to add the geofences to.

Entries.documentation: The batch of geofences to be added to the geofence collection.

GeofenceId.documentation: The geofence to be added to the specified geofence collection.

Geometry.documentation: Contains the polygon details to specify the position of the geofence.

BatchPutGeofenceRequestEntry.documentation: Contains details of geofences to be added to a specified geofence collection.

Errors.documentation: Contains additional error details for each geofence that failed to be added to a geofence collection.

Successes.documentation: Contains each geofence that was successfully added to the geofence collection.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

GeofenceId.documentation: The ID of the geofence successfully added to the geofence collection.

UpdateTime.documentation:
Specifies a timestamp for when the geofence was added to the geofence collection.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

BatchPutGeofenceSuccess.documentation: Contains a summary that lists each geofence that was successfuly added to a given geofence collection using >BatchPutGeofence

DeviceId.documentation: Refers to the device associated with the failed location update.

Error.documentation:
Provides additional details to add context to the error code.

Specifies the HTTP status response associated with the location update request.

SampleTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when a position sample was attempted.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

BatchUpdateDevicePositionError.documentation: Contains error details for each device that has failed to upload its location data to a tracker resource using

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource to update.

Updates.documentation: Contains the position update for each device.

Errors.documentation: A summary that contains error details for each device that failed to update its position.

ConflictException.documentation: The request was unsuccessful due to a conflict.

CollectionName.documentation:
A custom name for the geofence collection.

Requirements:

  • Contain only alphanumeric characters (A–Z, a–z, 0-9), hyphens (-), and underscores (_).

  • Must be a unique tracker resource name.

Description.documentation: An optional description for the geofence collection.

CollectionName.documentation: The name you've entered for the geofence collection.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence collection was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

Configuration.documentation: Contains the map style selected from an available provider.

Description.documentation: An optional description for the map resource.

MapName.documentation:
The name for the map resource.

Requirements:

  • Contain only alphanumeric characters (A–Z, a–z, 0–9), hyphens (-), and underscores (_).

  • Must be a unique map resource name.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the map resource was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

DataSource.documentation: The data source for the place index resource.

DataSourceConfiguration.documentation: The configuration settings for the chosen data source.

Description.documentation: The description for the place index resource.

IndexName.documentation:
The name for the place index resource.

Requirements:

  • Contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9) , hyphens (-) and underscores (_).

  • Must be a unique place index resource name.

CreateTime.documentation: The create time for the place index resource.

IndexArn.documentation: The ARN for the place index resource.

IndexName.documentation: The name for the place index resource.

Description.documentation: A custom description for the tracker resource.

TrackerName.documentation:
The name for the tracker resource.

Requirements:

  • Contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9) , hyphens (-) and underscores (_).

  • Must be a unique tracker resource name.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the tracker resource was created.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

TrackerArn.documentation: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the tracker resource.

TrackerName.documentation: The name you've entered for the tracker resource.

IntendedUse.documentation:
Specifies how the results of an operation will be stored by the caller.

Valid values include:

  • SingleUse specifies that the results won't be stored. When selecting this option, you cannot permanently store the results of SearchPlaceIndexForText or SearchPlaceIndexForPosition.

  • Storage specifies that the result can be cached or stored in a database.

Default value: SingleUse

DataSourceConfiguration.documentation: Contains configuration settings related to the chosen data source.

CollectionName.documentation: The name of the geofence collection to be deleted.

MapName.documentation: The name of the map resource to be deleted.

IndexName.documentation: The name of the place index resource to be deleted.

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource to be deleted.

CollectionName.documentation: The geofence collection associated to the description.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence resource was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

UpdateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence collection was last updated.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the map resource was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

Description.documentation: The description for the map resource description.

MapName.documentation: The map style selected from an available provider.

UpdateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the map resource was last updated.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

CreateTime.documentation: The time the place index resource was created.

DataSource.documentation: The data source for the place index resource.

DataSourceConfiguration.documentation: Contains the configuration settings for the chosen data source.

Description.documentation: The description for the place index resource.

IndexArn.documentation: The ARN of the place index resource being described.

IndexName.documentation: The name of the place index resource being described.

UpdateTime.documentation: The time the place index resource was last updated.

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource to describe.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the tracker resource was created.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

UpdateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the tracker resource was last updated.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

DeviceId.documentation: The ID of the device whose position you retrieved.

ReceivedTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the tracker resource recieved the position.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

SampleTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the position was detected and sampled.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

DevicePosition.documentation: Contains the position details retrieved from each device using GetDevicePosition or BatchGetDevicePosition.

DeviceId.documentation: The device identifier related to the position update.

Position.documentation:
Defines a point geometry object to represent a location using coordinates in the World Geodetic System (WGS 84) format and has the following properties:

  • x — Specifies the x coordinates or longitude.

  • y — Specifies the y coordinates or latitude.

  • z — Optional value that specifies the elevation relative to the ground surface. For example, when defining hills and mountains.

SampleTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the position was recieved by the geofence.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

DevicePositionUpdate.documentation: Specifies a location update for a device as a single point geometry.

ConsumerArn.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the geofence collection you want to disassociate from the tracker resource. An ARN is a unique identifier used to identify an AWS resource.

  • Format example: arn:partition:service:region:account-id:resource-type:resource-id

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource to be dissociated from the consumer.

Polygon.documentation: A linear ring or lines where the first and last vertex are the same to define a closed boundary. Each linear ring contains a list of vertices, containing a minimum of 1 vertex and a maxiumum of 4 vertices, represented as [longitude, latitude].

GeofenceGeometry.documentation: Contains a polygon object to describe the geofence position.

DeviceId.documentation: The ID of the device whose position history you want to retrieve.

EndTimeExclusive.documentation:
Specify the end time for the position history.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

  • The given time for EndTimeExclusive must be after the time for StartTimeInclusive.

NextToken.documentation:
The pagination token specifying which page of results to return in the response. If no token is provided, the default page will be the first page.

Default value: null

StartTimeInclusive.documentation:
Specify the start time for the position history.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

  • The given time for EndTimeExclusive must be after the time for StartTimeInclusive.

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource receiving the request for the device position history.

DevicePositions.documentation: Contains the position history details for the requested device.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token indicating there are additional pages available. You can use the token in a following request to fetch the next set of results.

DeviceId.documentation: The ID of the device whose position you want to retreieve.

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource receiving the position update.

DeviceId.documentation: The ID of the device whose position you retrieved.

ReceivedTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the tracker resource recieved the position.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

SampleTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the position was detected and sampled.

  • Use the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

CollectionName.documentation: The geofence collection storing the target geofence.

GeofenceId.documentation: The ID of the target geofence to retrieve the details from.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence collection was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

GeofenceId.documentation: The geofence ID associated with the description.

Geometry.documentation: Contains a polygon object to describe the geofence position.

Status.documentation:
Identifies the state of the geofence. A geofence will hold one of the following states:

  • ACTIVE — The geofence has been indexed by the system.

  • PENDING — The geofence is being processed by the system.

  • FAILED — The geofence failed to be indexed by the system.

  • DELETED — The geofence has been deleted from the system index.

  • DELETING — The geofence is being deleted from the sytem index.

UpdateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence collection was last updated.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

FontStack.documentation: A comma-separated list of fonts to load in order of preference.

FontUnicodeRange.documentation: A Unicode range to download characters. Used for displaying text as blocks of 256-code points on a map.

MapName.documentation: The map resource name associated with the glyph file.

Blob.documentation: The glyph file containing the glyph details for the configured map resource.

ContentType.documentation: The map glyph content type. For example, application/octet-stream.

FileName.documentation:
The name of the sprite file. Use the following file names:

  • sprites.png

  • sprites@2x.png

For JSON document specifying the sprite file location. Use the following file names:

  • sprites.json

  • sprites@2x.json

MapName.documentation: The map resource associated to the sprite file.

Blob.documentation: Contains the body of the sprite file or JSON sprite location description file.

ContentType.documentation: The sprite file and sprite location document content type.For example, The sprite content type is image/png, and the sprite location JSON document is application/json.

MapName.documentation: The map resource to retrieve the style descriptor from.

Blob.documentation: Contains the body of the style descriptor.

ContentType.documentation: The style descriptor content type. For example, application/json.

MapName.documentation: The map resource to retrieve the map tiles from.

X.documentation: The X value for the map tile.

Y.documentation: The Y value for the map tile.

Z.documentation:
The Z, or zoom, value for the map tile.

Map tiles are 256 x 256 pixel areas. A zoom value of 0 renders the entire world in a single map tile. Increasing the zoom level by 1 doubles the X and Y dimensions. For example, zooming in one level replaces a 1 tile with 4 tiles.

Blob.documentation: Contains the body of the map tile as a Mapbox Vector Tile (MVT).

ContentType.documentation: The map tile content type. For example, application/vnd.mapbox-vector-tile.

InternalServerException.documentation: The request has failed to process because of an unknown server error, exception, or failure.

NextToken.documentation:
The pagination token specifying which page of results to return in the response. If no token is provided, the default page will be the first page.

Default value: null

Entries.documentation: Lists the geofence collections that exist in your AWS account.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token indicating there are additional pages available. You can use the token in a following request to fetch the next set of results.

CollectionName.documentation: Specifies the geofence collection name assigned when the resource was created.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence collection was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

Description.documentation: The description for the geofence collection was created or last updated.

UpdateTime.documentation:
Specifies a timestamp for when the resource was last updated.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

ListGeofenceCollectionsResponseEntry.documentation: Contains summary data for a geofence collection listed by ListGeofenceCollections.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

Geometry.documentation: Contains a polygon object to describe the geofence position.

Status.documentation:
Identifies the state of the geofence. A geofence will hold one of the following states:

  • ACTIVE — The geofence has been indexed by the system.

  • PENDING — The geofence is being processed by the system.

  • FAILED — The geofence failed to be indexed by the system.

  • DELETED — The geofence has been deleted from the system index.

  • DELETING — The geofence is being deleted from the sytem index.

UpdateTime.documentation:
Specifies a timestamp for when the geofence was last updated.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

ListGeofenceResponseEntry.documentation: Contains the list of geofences in the specified geofence collection.

CollectionName.documentation: The name of the geofence collection to retrieve the list of geofences from.

NextToken.documentation:
The pagination token specifying which page of results to return in the response. If no token is provided, the default page will be the first page.

Default value: null

Entries.documentation: Contains the list of geofences in the specified geofence collection.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token indicating there are additional pages available. You can use the token in a following request to fetch the next set of results.

MaxResults.documentation:
An optional limit for the number of resources returned in a single call.

  • Default value: 100

NextToken.documentation:
The pagination token specifying which page of results to return in the response. If no token is provided, the default page will be the first page.

  • Default value: null

Entries.documentation: Contains a list of maps in your AWS account

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token indicating there are additional pages available. You can use the token in a following request to fetch the next set of results.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the map resource was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

DataSource.documentation: The provider of the map style selected for the map resource.

UpdateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the map resource was last updated.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss.

ListMapsResponseEntry.documentation: Contains details of an existing map resource in your AWS account.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results returned per request.

Default value: 100

NextToken.documentation:
The pagination token specifying which page of results to return in the response. If no token is provided, the default page is the first page.

Default value: null

Entries.documentation: Lists the place index resources that exist in your AWS account

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token indicating there are additional pages available. You can use the token in a following request to fetch the next set of results.

The pagination token specifying which page of results to return in the response. If no token is provided, the default page will be the first page.

Default value: null

TrackerName.documentation: The name of the tracker resource whose associated geofence collections you want to retrieve.

ConsumerArns.documentation: Contains the list of geofence collection ARNs associated to the tracker resource.

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token indicating there are additional pages available. You can use the token in a following request to fetch the next set of results.

The pagination token specifying which page of results to return in the response. If no token is provided, the default page will be the first page.

Default value: null

Entries.documentation: Lists the tracker resources that exist in your AWS account

NextToken.documentation: A pagination token indicating there are additional pages available. You can use the token in a following request to fetch the next set of results.

Style.documentation:
The name of the map style selected from an available provider.

  • Default style: VectorEsriLightGrayCanvas

Due to licensing limitations, you may not use HERE maps for Asset Management or Asset Tracking applications. For more information, see https://aws.amazon.com/service-terms/.

MapConfiguration.documentation: Contains the map style selected from an available provider.

AddressNumber.documentation: The numerical portion of an address, such as a building number.

Country.documentation: A country/region specified using the International Organization of Standardization (ISO 3166) 3-digit country/region code. For example, CAN.

Label.documentation: The full name and address of the point of interest such as a city, region, or country. For example, 123 Any Street, Any Town, USA.

Municipality.documentation: A name for a local area, such as a city or town name. For example, Toronto.

Neighborhood.documentation: The name of a community district. For example, Downtown.

PostalCode.documentation: A group of numbers and letters in a country-specific format, which accompanies the address for the purpose of identifying a location.

Region.documentation: A name for an area or geographical division, such as a province or state name. For example, British Columbia.

Street.documentation: The name for a street or a road to identify a location. For example, Main Street.

SubRegion.documentation: A country, or an area that's part of a larger region . For example, Metro Vancouver.

Place.documentation: Contains details about addresses or points of interest that match the search criteria.

PlaceGeometry.documentation: TODO: Karen, A place geometry is a geometry used to specify a location or a place.

CollectionName.documentation: The geofence collection to add the geofence to.

GeofenceId.documentation: An identifier for the geofence to be added. For example, ExampleGeofence-1.

Geometry.documentation: Contains the polygon details to specify the position of the geofence.

CreateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence was created.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

GeofenceId.documentation: The geofence identifier entered in the request.

UpdateTime.documentation:
The timestamp for when the geofence was last updated.

  • Uses the ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The resource that you've entered was not found in your AWS account.

Place.documentation: Contains details about the relevant point of interest.

SearchForPositionResult.documentation: Specifies a single point of interest, or place as a result of a search query obtained from a dataset configured in the Place index Resource.

Place.documentation: Contains details about the relevant point of interest.

IndexName.documentation: The name of the place index resource you want to use for the search.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results returned per request.

Default value: 50

Position.documentation:
Specifies a coordinate for the query defined by a longitude, latitude, and an optional altitude.

  • The first position defined is the x coordinate, or longitude.

  • The second position defined is the y coordinate, or latitude.

  • The third position defined is the z coordinate, or altitude.

For example, position=xLongitude&position=yLatitude&position=zAltitude .

Results.documentation: A list of places closest to the specified position. Each result contains additional information about the places returned.

DataSource.documentation: The data provider chosen for the place index resource.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results returned per request.

Default value: 50

Position.documentation: The position given in the reverse geocoding request.

SearchPlaceIndexForPositionSummary.documentation: A summary of the reverse geocoding request sent using SearchPlaceIndexForPosition.

BiasPosition.documentation:
Searches for results closest to the given position. An optional parameter defined by longitude, latitude, and an optional altitude.

  • The first bias position defined is the x coordinate, or longitude.

  • The second bias position defined is the y coordinate, or latitude.

  • The third bias position defined is the z coordinate, or altitude.

For example, bias=xLongitude&bias=yLatitude&biaz=zAltitude.

FilterBBox.documentation:
Given the coordinates of a bounding box, filters the results by returning places within the specified area. An optional parameter.

The first 3 bbox parameters define the lower southwest corner and may include an optional altitude:

  • The first bbox position defined is the x coordinate or longitude for the lower southwest corner.

  • The second bbox position defined is the y coordinate or latitude for the lower southwest corner.

  • The third bbox position defined is the z coordinate or altitude for the lower southwest corner.

For example, bbox=xLongitudeSW&bbox=yLatitudeSW&bbox=zAltitudeSW.

The following bbox parameters define the upper northeast corner and may include an optional altitude:

  • The fourth bbox position defined is the x coordinate or longitude for the upper northeast corner.

  • The fifth bbox position defined is the y coordinate or longitude for the upper northeast corner.

  • The sixth bbox position defined is the z coordinate or altitude for the upper northeast corner.

  • For example, bbox=xLongitudeNE&bbox=yLatitudeNE&bbox=zAltitudeNE.

FilterCountries.documentation:
Limits the search to the given a list of countries/regions. An optional parameter.

  • Use the ISO 3166 3-digit country code. For example, Australia uses three upper-case characters: AUS.

IndexName.documentation: The name of the place index resource you want to use for the search.

MaxResults.documentation:
The maximum number of results returned per request.

The default: 50

Text.documentation: The address, name, city, or region to be used in the search. In free-form text format. For example, 123 Any Street.

Results.documentation: A list of places closest to the specified position. Each result contains additional information about the specific point of interest.

Summary.documentation: Contains a summary of the request. Contains the BiasPosition, DataSource, FilterBBox, FilterCountries, MaxResults, ResultBBox, and Text.

BiasPosition.documentation: Contains the coordinates for the bias position entered in the geocoding request.

DataSource.documentation: Contains data provider chosen for the place index resource.

FilterBBox.documentation: Contains the coordinates for the optional bounding box coordinated entered in the geocoding request.

FilterCountries.documentation: Contains the country filter entered in the geocoding request.

MaxResults.documentation: Contains the maximum number of results indicated for the request.

ResultBBox.documentation: A bounding box that contains the search results within the specified area indicated by FilterBBox. A subset of bounding box specified using FilterBBox.

Text.documentation:
The address, name, city or region to be used in the geocoding request. In free-form text format.

  • For example, Vancouver.

SearchPlaceIndexForTextSummary.documentation: A summary of the geocoding request sent using SearchPlaceIndexForText.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The request was denied due to request throttling.

FieldList.documentation: The field where the invalid entry was detected.

Reason.documentation: A message with the reason for the validation exception error.

ValidationException.documentation: The input failed to meet the constraints specified by the AWS service.

Message.documentation: A message with the reason for the validation exception error.

Name.documentation: The field name where the invalid entry was detected.

ValidationExceptionField.documentation: The input failed to meet the constraints specified by the AWS service in a specified field.

documentation: Suite of geospatial services including Maps, Places, Tracking, and Geofencing
